abstract.text: An abstract base class for print formatters, which are objects that lay out custom printable content that can cross page boundaries.

inlineContent.text: Given a print formatter, the printing system can automate the printing of the type of content associated with the print formatter. Examples of such content could be a web view, a mix of images and text, or a long text document. The UIKit framework provides several concrete subclasses of
You can assign a single print formatter for a print job using the
shared instance; or you can specify one or more print formatters that are associated with specific pages of a page renderer through the
. A page renderer is an instance of a custom subclass of

publishes an interface that allows you to specify the starting page for a print job and the margins around the printed content; given that information plus the content, a print formatter computes the number of pages for the print job. The following image depicts the print-formatter properties, along with certain
properties, that define the layout of a multipage print job.
arenâ€™t recommended. If you have custom content to print, use a custom

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An object that lays out HTML text for a multipage print job.
An abstract base class for print formatters, which are objects that lay out custom printable content that can cross page boundaries.
The distances the edges of content are inset from the printing rectangle.
Draws the portion of a print formatterâ€™s content for the specified area of the specified page.
The maximum height of the content area.
The maximum width of the content area.
The number of pages to print.
The margins for each printed page.
Returns the page renderer for the print formatter.
Returns the area that encloses a specified page of content.
Removes the print formatter from the page renderer.
A Boolean value that determines whether the system executes the print formatterâ€™s rendering operations on the main thread.
The index of the first page that the print formatter lays out.
A user interface that manages the printing of documents, images, and other printable content in iOS.
An object that lays out the content of pages according to the kind of content.
An object that draws pages of content to print, with or without the assistance of print formatters.
Adds a print formatter to the page renderer starting at the specified page.
The size of paper for a print job and the rectangular area that the content prints within.
An object that lays out plain text for printing, possibly over multiple pages.
An object that lays out the drawn content of a view for printing.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
